body_html: @RylanSchaeffer , yes that's correct. At the time, ebrevdo's code was pre 1.2 but post 1.1. In the 1.2 release, some other naming has changed as well. For example AttentionWrapper's attention_size is now attention_layer_size. If you are using my above code, check the AttentionWrapper page for the new __init__ arguments.
body_text: @RylanSchaeffer , yes that's correct. At the time, ebrevdo's code was pre 1.2 but post 1.1. In the 1.2 release, some other naming has changed as well. For example AttentionWrapper's attention_size is now attention_layer_size. If you are using my above code, check the AttentionWrapper page for the new __init__ arguments.
body: @RylanSchaeffer , yes that's correct. At the time, ebrevdo's code was pre 1.2 but post 1.1. In the 1.2 release, some other naming has changed as well. For example AttentionWrapper's `attention_size` is now `attention_layer_size`. If you are using my above code, check the [AttentionWrapper page](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/seq2seq/AttentionWrapper) for the new `__init__` arguments.
